text: What can I say? Have never felt so at home at a bar anywhere, including back in WI. Love the bar staff, grill, patio, curds, decor, and of course celebrating Packer & Badger wins (or on the rare occasion, drowning sorrows after a loss). 5 stars doesn't seem to do it justice, 5 musky's is more like it.
Food is decent, a great place to watch Wisconsin sports.

Will's was my home away from home when I lived in Chicago. From the moment I first walked in, I knew I would be frequenting this place often. If you're a Packer fan, of course this is the must visit spot for the Sunday game. If you're not, no worries, the fans are friendly and the bartenders aren't picky about who orders drinks! Every night of the week they have some type of drink special. If it's your first time, note that during game days there's no table service, so you order from the bar and take a number to your table.  Over the years I've seen this bar change for the better. The staff is always friendly and welcoming, and they have done amazing things to their outdoor patio, which for the winter months becomes covered with a tent and heaters! Jimmy, Rob and Gus are three of the best bartenders around, and they are always there to greet you with a smile and a cold beer, or a bloody mary if necessary.  Fun fact, I love this bar so much I actually moved around the corner from it for a while. Now that I'm far away in Denver, I wish I could still frequent this place for a Sunday Funday or after-work pick-me-up... but alas, I still am trying to find a bar in Denver that can make me feel as home to Wisconsin as this wonderful bar has done for me! Long story short, drop in for an old fashioned, a Leinenkugel or whatever beer you'd like (they have plenty draft & bottle selections. You will be treated with a Wisconsin hospitality that you won't find anywhere else in Chi-town. Cheers!
Wonderful cheese curds, great patio that allows dogs, taste beer. Definitely will go back here again for food and drinks.

Best cheesecurds within a billion mile radius. For real. Also, their cheeseburgers and chicken tenders are perfect. We've been here over 20 times and every time it's consistent every time. They have a pool table with free popcorn inside and an Outdoor eating area with bags in the summer. You'll feel like your in Wisconsin, in a good way!!

This place is really cool. Dog friendly bar which is pretty awesome. Cheap drinks decent crowd. They close the patio at midnight which is understandable. I just wish they would have let us know ahead of time. Our whole party had to go back inside and we lost our table. Because it became so crowded. It's also really small inside. The bathrooms are horrible and ridiculously small. I could barely move in there when there are two people in side. All and all it was a great atmosphere and I would definitely go back. The only reason it's not five stars is because of the facilities and the fact we got kicked out of the patio.
The place is a great neighborhood bar with good drinks and even better prices! I've been here twice and have always had a good time!

We went for the first time last night to play Trivia. The food was borderline disgusting. Terrible quality, the burger was so thin and the bun was huge. There is also free popcorn that was stale. Disappointing overall.  However, they have pretty good drink specials and a great outdoor patio. I would only go again for the atmosphere.

Baja fish tacos are a steal for your stomach and your wallet, as well as some of the best draft deals I've seen on the north side. Great choice for a group gathering as long as it's not on a Packers Badgers Brewers Bucks game day in which case you should get there super early to claim a spot (they don't call it 'Camp Randall South' for nothing)

This place is a blue collar paradise. If you like to play bar games, then stay away from Wills because you'll never go back home to your wife. Darts, pool, and bags. If I had to compare this bar to any basketball player it would undoubtedly be Larry Bird. Insider tip: the cheese curds will make a grown man cry tears of happiness.

As a UW band alumna, I was introduced to Will's Northwoods through a gig.  The band has always had terrific service and food, and the same can be said as a regular customer.  I recently went to Chicago to visit an old roommate and eagerly suggested we try out Will's Friday night fish fry (as any Wisconsinite does).  I was initially worried that there might be no room as I assumed the patio was closed for the winter, but I was delighted to find out that it had in fact been covered and heated to accommodate seating.  We sat at the bar in the back and received prompt service from a friendly and engaging bartender.  There was a bit of a wait for food, but that was to be expected since the place was so packed.  Everything was delicious, and I will always come back whenever I'm in the area! The only issue I had with the entire experience is that my old roommate tricked me into taking a shot of Malört.  Ugh.

Overall: The epitome of what a midwestern bar should be. Don't pass up Will's if that catches your eye at all. The good: Pretty much the best WI atmosphere you could ask for. Plus, cheese curds, free popcorn, good music, huge patio, all around good times. If you're looking for a pub or dive you can't beat Will's The not-so-good: The food is good WI bar food, but somehow every time I eat it my stomach turns for the worse. Atmosphere: 12/10 Service: 10/10 Food: 8/10
Katie and Mike should work every Sunday. Mike is rad. Katie is a world traveler. This place rocks. Soup of the day is on point.

Best. Place. Ever. People, food, drinks = amazing. I moved in. Katie and mike are my new church! Blissful every Sunday! Try Dijon mustard in your Bloody Mary - you won't be disappointed. This place is amazing!
Fucking love Wills. Best Wisconsin bar in Chicago, and the only place to watch badgers or packers game. Summer on the patio is amazing but it's a fun time all year round.
I really felt the lover for the packers here. May find my future husband here.  I can't date a bears fan and no better place to meet fellow fans than here!

Was back in town with some friends, walked from Wrigley and this place has the Midwest vibe I find myself missing sometimes down here in FL. Cheese curds, popcorn, darts, PBR, sometimes you need the simple things in life.

Would give this place 10 stars if I could.  Having both Celiac Disease (inability have have gluten or anything that has touched, been cooked with/on a shared cooking surface) and being allergic to caesin (protein in milk products) I have a hard time going out to eat, getting people to understand and take my dietary restrictions seriously.  I went to Will's this past Sunday for the GB Packers game and even with a bar packed to the brim, the manager, bar tender, waitress, and chef I got to speak to about my restrictions.  They came back out and clarified on things hey we're unsure of and it was THE BEST experience I have had eating out since my diagnosis (and that includes some really nice steak houses too)!  Without a doubt recommend, the customer service is phenomenal, even when they're so busy!

I am absolutely obsessed with this place.  It is my go-to bar for any Badger football or basketball games.  The staff is friendly, the outdoor space is fantastic, and the food is actually decent! One complaint: the restrooms are disgusting. However, I'm still in love with this place and recommend it to any Badger fan.
A hidden gem indeed. Almost 2 years of living 3 blocks away, I found my go-to bar. This place is awesome. Pool, popcorn, 50 cent wings, tvs, patio, trivia, I could go on. Zang zang

I've been here several times and I love this bar. They have one of the best outdoor patios so I guess that it doesn't bother me that it's a greenbay bar. They have everything fried, so the food is decent. The trivia on Tuesday is really fun and they have good drink deals

Very casual, comfortable corner tavern. The staff could not be kinder or more accommodating. Kevin the manager will bend over backwards to help you host a party there. Food is fried, Wisconsin grub but very tasty and not expensive. Great drinks, great food, free street parking and kid/dog friendly. best pub in town.

UPDATE: Visited Wills again with a couple girlfriends when one of the managers, Kevin suggested we come see the outdoor patio, and no regrets here! Great outdoor space with lots of room,tables, games and a great bar. This may have to become  my go-to day drinking spot because it seems to be everyone else's! Will definitely be back! Thanks for the hookup Kevin!  Pretty standard dive bar! Good amount of space between front and back bar. Tables line each of the walls and there seemed to be plenty of seating especially for a late Friday night. Affordable, top shelf booze cost you no more than $6, which is always a treat in the city.  It's a tough task to replace my current dive bar go-to's, so I wouldn't say it's quite there but will definitely be back if I'm in the area!
Super great service! Everyone was prompt and nice! Just wish there was a little bit more air conditioning to make it feel more comfortable inside!

Wills Northwoods Inn is a hidden gem as far as I'm concerned.  For some reason I never knew this place existed until this past weekend! My friends and I were searching for a patio after the Belmont Sheffield Music Fest and found Northwoods.   This patio is among the best I've been to in Chicago.  Wooden tables and benches, rustic ambience, and a giant moose statue make this place worth seeking out.   The drinks were actually quite reasonably priced at $4 drafts (on a Saturday no less!) and the staff was pretty attentive.  The best part of Northwoods? THE TAMALE GUY STOPS BY! :)

Came here for a surprise party! They have an AMAZING party deal where you can get a keg along with the upstairs party room for a super fair price. If you run out of beer, simply purchase another keg! They make it so easy. Super great, laid back environment and the food is pretty good, too! Can't wait to come back for football season.

I was born and raised in Wisconsin, and coming to Will's Northwoods felt like home. This is exactly the type of place you would expect to go in Northern Wisconsin. The decor is spot on - fish plaques on the wall, Packers and Badgers signs everywhere, and the random stuffed puma by the bar. The vibe is great.  In true Wisconsin fashion, everyone who works here is so friendly and nice! It's a great group of people running the bar. Service was quick, and of course, the prices can't be beat. For a Chicago bar, the draft prices and deals are fantastic. No craft beers, but it sticks true to Wisconsin with Leinenkugel and Miller Lite on draft. Of course, order the cheese curds!!!  This place also does awesome events. I'm talking, Seinfeld Thursdays, Packers and Badgers events, a Euchre league, and Musky fest. Whether you are a true Wisconsinite or just want a friendly, relaxing bar to frequent, Will's Northwoods is the place to go. (Or at least stop by for the sake of taking a picture with a giant moose).

This is by far the best bar I go to in Lakeview. I live down the street and can't imagine a bar that feels more homey with friendlier staff. My favorite things about Will's are the all-you-can eat Friday fish fry, the cheap Leinenkugel drafts on tap, the friendly wait and bar staff, and the dart boards and jukebox they have. It can get crowded here on a weekend night or Saturday afternoon so arrive early!  I've never lived in Northern Wisconsin but this is exactly what I feel a bar there would be like. Don't leave without having a Leinenkugel original, cheese curd appetizer, and a burger! Also they have great specials on PBR almost daily and even the house salad was impressive!

One of the best bars in Chicago. Amazing food. The staff is absolutely amazing, beyond friendly. It has a really good atmosphere and is the perfect bar to go get rowdy at. If you're a packers fan, it would be a sin to not see a game here. Sophie the bartendress is really friendly and always goes out of her way to make cool, experimental drinks for me. These guys treat guests like family. Solid prices and again, the atmosphere is really unique; especially on a game day.

I had the cheese balls which were tasty. Prices were okay. The bartender was hard to get a hold of and it wasn't super busy. Kind of a strange vibe there during a week night around 10pm. But I like the atmosphere in general which is why I went in the first place.

A lot of other joints in the city have advertised as Wisconsin bars, but I have not come across one that has an atmosphere (although it can be a bit schitcky), energy, and clientele that transports you to Wisconsin during the game.   Crowd during games skews younger, but there is a nice mix of folks of all ages.   They have some seating, but you need to get to the place early on game day if you want to grab any of it.   Game day specials (and drink prices in general) are reasonable.   They get the grill going outside on game days and sell good, no frills burgers for cheap.   (Note:  They shut down their regular kitchen during games.)   Half time raffle used to add to the experience, but has really fallen off over the last few years.

I cannot say enough about this place. We had our work Christmas party at Will's and everyone had a blast! Kevin was wonderful to work with and the staff was extremely kind and helpful. The decorations were great and Will's has that warm, cozy feel to it. Thanks again to everyone at Will's!

As a Green Bay Packers fan, this bar is amazing.  If you don't get here at least 1-2 hours early on game day, you can forget about ever getting inside.  It gets packed, and the atmosphere is as good as Lambeau Field.  If you're from Wisconsin, but you live in Chicago, you need to experience Will's Northwoods Inn.  Everyone is friendly (staff and patrons), and the drinks are huge!  I love that you can get bratwurst and cheese curds on game day!  Go Pack Go!
Fantastic atmosphere. The absolute best fries I have ever eaten. Every leinenkugels beer imaginable on draft. Amazing service! Couldn't ask for anything more

Great atmosphere whether you are a Packers fan or a die hard Bears fan. Friendly service is very tentative. Food is good and the cheese curds are absolutely amazing. Patio is awesome during good weather. We have come to the bar during a Packers game and during a random weeknight game and the ambience is still a fun and friendly. Located in a quiet neighborhood.

I really like this place! A little piece of Wisconsin in Chicago. A little Wisconsin kitsch, but I always enjoy a good theme. The food selection is pretty standard, but everything I have eaten here is above average to outstanding. The staff is also great and have personalities that make the place fun and interesting. It's just the type of bar that works! I can always rely on them for a good time!

If you are a packer fan in Chicago, you need to come here. By far the best place to watch a packer game in the city. It feels like you're in Wisconsin. The people, the decor, the food and drink... Get here early - it gets busy. My strategy is usually come around 10 for brunch before a noon game, get a good seat, and ride it out through the game. Food is pretty good here. They transition to grilling and deep frying outside once the game starts. They have a DJ and a guy announcing the raffle and other stuff. It's a whole experience.
I booked a party for the back room and it was AMAZING... the staff was so helpful and the bartenders were so great!!  I'm already starting to think of an excuse to have another shindig there :)

Summers were made for Will's beer garden.  Its in an unassuming location, which means that you arent surrounded by the crowds in Wrigleyville or Lincoln Park.  When you are at Wills, you will be next to college seniors, 30 somethings, and 40 year old parents looking to get away.  Its one of my favorite (if not favorite) place in the city for day drinking during the city, and its laid back atmosphere is one of the best places in the area to just kick back, relax, and hang out with friends with some cold drinks.  The prices are good, the atmosphere is great (you may want to avoid it when Wisc or Packers play if you are not a fan), and everyone is just downright NICE.   This place also has some of the most amazing Salads.  Yes, its a Wisconsin bar (and yes, their cheese curds can NOT be passed up) but the salads!  They are served in HUGE bowls, are fresh and delicious!  Its a great summer lunch or dinner spot.  But I also love it in the winter.   Having moved to the suburbs, this is one of my most missed places in the city!
Awesome Packers bar in the heart of rivalry country!
Best neighborhood bar. Fun for watching the packers and badgers, but you have to get there really early. I like it better on non gamedays when it's less busy. The patio is nice and dog friendly!
Been back into this place and was cool, friendly bar. Just don't sit at the back bar as only miller lite on tap .

Solid place. Decent food, great drink selection and friendly service. The bartender remembered my name all night which I appreciate. The back patio is nice too. It is a fun summer spot. Im sure we'll be back.

Fantastic place.  Great beer selection.  The customer is made to feel welcome.  A friendly spot.  I just love the Wisconsin theme. You can RELAX here and enjoy people.  The Staff is not busy looking through you to get to your wallet, as is common in a lot of bars in the area. THE PLACE IS FUN!!!!

I now live in the neighborhood.  The staff from buses to bartenders is simply outstanding, efficient, friendly, and really great neighbors.  It's a hardcore Packers and Wisconsin bar obviously, but the patio is top notch and the food and beers are quite good.  Friendly ambiance, darts, jukebox, and considering how busy they can get, the crowd is usually very cheerful and not obnoxious.  Lived near them 13 years ago, glad to be back in their neighborhood. Taxis can be a hassle to get there on weekend nights so plan to Uber or Lyft if you aren't walking home.

I love Tuesday Trivia night! It's definitely a Packers bar....so if you love the Packers, you'll feel right at home. It's a super casual place, which is great because on Tuesdays I'm usually feeling pretty lazy, so feel no pressure to impress when I come to trivia. I will say it can get competitive, so I bring my super smart friend who knows everything! He usually carries our team and some free drinks end the night! PS everything is fried....delicious but it'll clog your arteries!
Had a great experience tonight at Will's. Wonderful staff and very very good cheese curds. Happy environment!
Great spot great bartenders friendly and polite even when its jammers a local gem strongly advise you visit even more cozy in the winter

I guess this is a Wisconsin themed bar and based on all the taxidermy on the wall I believe it. I was only here for a few hours but they got the job done. Plenty of TVs and their alcohol was pretty cheap. $5 for a well vodka drink. It didn't look like they have too many beers on tap though. Cute place, friendly environment. Wasnt too crowded for the Friday night that I was there. Plenty of room and open seats at the bars. You definitely won't be struggling to order a drink

We went here for the cheesecurds, and they were supposed to be one of the top five best cheese curds in Chicago. But we definitely have had better. A little too breaded/fried but the cheese was good. They were accommodating to special requests/orders and the bartender (our server for the night) was super friendly. Would definitely go back with a group of friends for a sports night.

If I was a Packers fan, I'd probably give this place 5 stars.  As it is, I'm still giving it a solid 4+.  The highlight is the service and atmosphere.  This is one of the friendliest bars in the city.  No abundance of bros or hipsters or trixies, just a solid crowd of people who just want to have a good time.  Good beer selection and prices.  I've not had any food other than the deep-fried basics, and I don't go by that since anyone can throw stuff in a fryer.  I do want to come back and have some real food at some point as the reviews generally indicate it's pretty good.  Free popcorn = good.  Beer garden = good.  I'll definitely be coming back.

Will's is truly Camp Randall South. The Wisconsin spirit is contagious and it feels like you are right back in college. The bar recently adding an awning to their outdoor space so that it can be used year-round.  They grill brats and burgers ($3) on game days -- nothing goes better with Leine than a brat :) The best part is when they pass around a sausage/cheese plate during games. It's the perfect little snack!

So I've heard about this place from the Packers Everywhere app for Packers proud bars in enemy territory! So my dad and I always go to lunch before we go to the auto show and we finally got to try this place out! We will definitely be back for a game when we aren't at Lambeau!  So inside the bar there is a tasteful amount of awesome sports memorabilia. Maybe it's because I'm a Packers fan but it was awesome to see because we don't get to see a lot of it around here.  I got the Northwoods Cheeseburger. It came in a basket with fries. It was definitely a solid lunch. Everything was delicious and obviously fresh. We didn't get any drinks because we were on a bit of a schedule but the drink prices seem very reasonable for Chicago alcohol prices!  It looks like there is a big brunch menu on the weekend...$5 mimosas, definitely can't go wrong there.  The service was quick and very friendly! The bartenders interacted with us throughout our whole meal. Will be back many times. And we will bring many Cheeseheads with us!

I brought an out of town Packers fan here today to check it out.  The bartender and our server couldn't have been any friendlier and welcoming.  As other reviews mentioned, the crowd was really mixed ages, and I think everyone would feel comfortable here.  The Bulls were playing the Lakers and although we stayed just long enough to sadly watch the Bulls lose, it was long enough to get that warm and toasty Northwoods feeling from this cozy, paneled place.  Go ahead and grab your flannel shirt and head on over.

I MADE IT IN! ! NOT ONLY DID WE MAKE IT IN,  BUT We found a new home.  This is a neighborhood bar,  where everyone literally knows everyone's name.  Age is something that doesn't exist in this bar, as in the crowd is mixed with old young etc.  We met Kevin who is hands down an Amazing Host and leader for a phenomenal team.  The customer service is above and beyond.  When walking in you're greeted by a moose and very eccentric light fixtures.  Bar tables,  tvs, and friendly faces.  There's another room equipped with a pool table and dart board.  And a juke box.  The food we had was amazing.  Everything we tried was really tasty. We worked are way through the great beer list,  and had a Jameson or two.  Absolutely such a great time.  Oh yes this is a Wisconsin bar.  Pretty cool. I also read that there's a, patio.  I can't wait for summer.  I'll be back soon!

Tried to find a "Minnesota bar" in Chicago to no avail.  Wah!  So, we came here to watch the Gopher vs Badger Big 10 game.  Wow!  What great Wisconsin camaraderie AND they were good to Minnesota fans (it helps the Gophers lost).  There were probably 10 opposing fans in that entire bar otherwise, be prepared, it's all Wisconsin. There were many sections of the bar to hang out:  the patio, the tent, the bar itself.  It was a pretty cool atmosphere.  We sat on the patio and stayed warm next to the metal fire pit.  Loved the grilling and free halftime raffle:  cheese curds $8, burgers and hot dogs for $3, onion rings, and the raffle was generous with Will's Northwoods Inn and Badger paraphernalia give-aways. I would say 80% of the crowd is in their 20's. It's a college crowd.  It felt very safe.  Nobody was in a drunken stupor or inappropriate.  There are plenty of TV's and speakers; in fact one could say it was almost too loud and echoey. Areas for improvement: 1. Dry vs wet wood for the fire pits.  Got smoked out.  Maybe gas heaters? 2. Protect the wooden benches from rain so on game day they're not wet and dirty.  Nobody wanted to sit on them. 3.  More chairs and bar stools.  3.5-4 hrs of standing.  Ugh. 4.  Muddy grilling and raffle area.  Grass protection mats would've been perfect. I'm a Packer fan so this place would be SO much fun and if I'm in Chicago during game day, I would come here.

If you're coming to watch games and eat- you should manage your expectations by knowing that: It's a fine venue for watching the games. There are no waiters of waitresses...you just sit at a table. You find a menu where you can- pick something out and walk up to the bar and place an order for food drinks etc. and walk back up when you want something else. Really? The food is not very good. Example: for brunch, my wife wanted to order a breakfast burrito, which is a standard brunch item- but she wanted it to be made using egg whites and no meat.  They cannot prepare food to order as the breakfast burrito "filler" is prepared ahead of time with meat and standard cartoned eggs. The cheescurds were- just bland, the dipping sauce- bland. The turkey sandwich had cheap sliced meat. When you eat bar food, it helps to like the taste of the deep fried, calorie rich food and we both thought it tasted like cheap stuff purchased from Costco in bulk. Served in paper baskets.  I'm surprised at the number of high reviews- amazed actually. It's not often that I just do not like a venue- I will not give it another shot.

This place is insane - I couldn't get a table last Sunday!!!!  Why?  Because this place is awesome!   Had a blast during the football game. Everyone was friendly - staff and patrons. Good food. Ended up sharing table space with a bunch of different people - no problem.  Stayed well after the game because it was so comfortable. Looking forward to going back.  Parking was tough, but worth it.

Descriptive phrase: Badger/Packer/Wisconsin bar. Will's does a fantastic job of bringing the wooded-Wisconsin feel to Chicago. On a Badger gameday it was packed to the brim, inside and outside, with Bucky-faithful. Everyone was having a good time, TVs were plentiful, drinks were decently-priced and food was okay (I'd skip the biscuits and gravy next time). Outside that day they even closed down the street and had a Green Bay Packer rally with old players.  If you're in town and need to get your Wisco-fix, Will's is about as authentic as they come.

This is a great spot for what it is ... a Packers and Badgers bar. Although there are a few Badgers bars in Chicago, this one is the loudest and has the best atmosphere.  Get there early on a game day.  It has a nice patio if the weather is OK.  Food is OK, but there atmosphere is what it is all about.

My old roommate and I lived above the place for around a decade.  I'm not a Packers fan *ducks*, but I loved this bar.  Great food, reasonably priced drinks, and a nice atmosphere. Let me tell you a secret though- go to this place for weekend brunch.  Seriously, pick a weekend when there isn't some Wisconsin game, and go.  It is incredible.  The French toast is todiefor, and they even serve cheese curds in the AM.  And if you go when there isn't a game, there is ZERO wait, unlike some of the other more popular (and more expensive) brunch spots.  Totally worth it.  I still live in the city, and have yet to find a place that comes close to Will's brunch (especially for that price). Shout out to Colleen, my favorite waitress (I miss you, I need to say hi!), and the great bartenders.

Be wary, this is a Wisconsin/Packers bar, but if you avoid game day, it's fantastic. Nice laid-back atmosphere, good beer on tap, lovely beer garden--it's a great escape from the Wrigleyville scene. Plus, they have cheese curds!

this place was awesome!!!! will be going back we where here Thursday for the packers game and it was excellent even though we got there at 5:30 pm..... everyone else who complaints i can honestly say they are upset that this is a packers bar :) to the people who are not happy.... we all know you are mad because this is a packers bar!!!!!  btw i lost one of the raffles by ONE number :(

Love love love this place!  Been here a few times to watch Packer games, and a few times for other things, and I've always had a good visit.  Was there for brunch last Sunday, the guy at the bar was very nice in coming over to our table, taking our order (even though I think it was more of an "order at the bar" type of situation) and answered all of our questions.  The food was good, and holy huge portions!  Cheese curds are good too, maybe not the best in the city but certainly satisfying for this Wisconsin transplant.  They have reasonable prices too, and lots of good deals.  It can get a little loud during games but eh, what do you expect during a football game.

I've been to Will's 2 times (non-Packers Monday Night Football and a Friday Happy Hour in the Beer Garden). Both visits were great. I played darts, enjoyed some free popcorn, and had a very chill time. The bartenders are extremely friendly and the crowd is people in their mid-20's (a few years old than the giant Clark Street bars). This is a great bar if you are with several friends. People seem to come here in groups and stay in those groups, so if you are looking to meet new people I would recommend another bar. But definitely give Will's a try sometime! Apparently a lot of fun for Badger and Packers games as well.

Off the chart awesome.  Great Midwest (Wisconsin/northwoods) Bar. Drink,  Food & Staff were well worth the reasonable prices.  Cheese Curds were Epic!  Cant imagine how this place rocks during Football season.  We'll be back, our non-Wisconsin friends are now Badger & Packer fans (kind of)
Great neighborhood bar. Can't believe how good the food is. Get wills style poutine. Great drinks and if you're a packers fan you're are in luck.

Beer list is pretty good and cheap, service was good, appetizers were meh (fried cheese curds and poutine), and the patio is dog-friendly. We sat on the patio with a couple beers and food, and while the patio space is large, there were very few shaded areas to be found, which might be the biggest deterring factor for me sitting on the patio again in the dead of summer.

I'm unclear as to what all the hype is about. We went to Will's on a Thursday night for dinner and drinks. We live down the street and have been meaning to stop in for over a year.  The service was very slow and they appeared to be grossly understaffed. The server didn't have a beer list so we had to get up and look at what beers were on tap.  The cheese curds were nothing to write home about. The cheese curds at Bad Apple are the best in the city and are waaaay better than these. The rest of the food was greasy and the burger over cooked.  I suspect we visited on and off night; however with all the other neighborhood options for drinks and pub food within walking distance (Diag), we won't be back.

I love this place. If you're a Packer or Badger fan, Will's is a must. The atmosphere on game day is hard to beat--it feels like you're at a bar in Madison. The bartenders are great--there is one guy who always wears a funny yellow hat. He's the best! If you go there a few times he'll remember your name.  The food is delish and cheap on game day. Cheese curds, brats, burgers...yum! I wish their bloody marys were better during games, but oh well, guess I'll stick with the giant $6 taps!

Only a review of the patio: Came here as part of a patio pub crawl and loved the back patio. It was in a neighborhood and seemed almost like a wonderful hidden secret. We got a bunch of pitchers of beer so I can't speak to anything other than we had a great time in their open back space and left with a feeling that we were welcomed by the staff as well as happy with the space and neighborhood feeling. Check it out for yourself!

Love Will's! Great bar food (tater tots are amazing) and love the Fresh free popcorn! The outdoor patio is fabulous and great for the recent spring weather. The servers are so kind and really on-the-ball with our typically larger group.

Will's is the quintessential neighborhood bar. Northwoods motif and you just feel comfortable there. The beer garden is excellent, staff is super friendly and they sponsor sports teams like ours. We've made it our weekly hangout going on three seasons-and no other bar has ever taken such great care of us. Check it out, there's probably a stool calling your name.

I have only been to Wills twice but both visits were positive . The bartender knew just about everyone that came in . The food was very good both times and they have a  nice selection of draft beers .   Folks from the neighborhood came in got messages had a quick beer and left . This is my kind of place just wish I did not live 400 miles to the north . ( MICHIGAN )... This is not a overpriced venue like you would find on the N. Clark strip.  Based on our visits we will be going back .

Honestly, this is one of my favorite neighborhood bars in Lakeview. The waitstaff is bomb. The TOTS are bomb. AND they have free popcorn - what the what?! Aside from the fact it's a Wisconsin/Packers bar (go Bears!), it's a great spot to watch a game with friends, play trivia on Tuesdays and/or have a drink in the beer garden that puts all other beer gardens to shame. I can't say enough good things about this place!
Love this place.  Mondays they have $.50 wings and $8 pitchers of Leiny.  Usually sit outdoors because they have such an awesome patio!!!

Third time here wasn't a charm. I've tried the steak tacos, a chicken caesar wrap and now the chicken fingers tossed in buffalo. All in all a resounding "meh." Granted, I've been sober every time. Maybe it would be better if I was drunk.

I had attempted to go to Will's one time before during football season with some Packer fans, but didn't make it through the door.  This time, I was out on a pub crawl with a large group of friends, and we were able to make ourselves at home in the back corner of the back patio.  Their beer selection isn't that vast because they offer mostly beers from Wisconsin, which I can take or leave.  But, the back patio is also place to hang out on on a beautiful summer day.

Recently stopped by here with a friend to enjoy a nice lunch al fresco. My friend and I split an order of cheese curds because you can't go to a Wisconsin themed joint without trying cheese curds. We were glad we did because they were Sooo good!!  I had the Cobb salad and it was delicious. Fresh, light, just the perfect amount of each ingredient. I loved it. My friend ordered the special which were 3 steak tacos and she said she really enjoyed them. All in all, a nice lunch enjoyed under the sun. We will be back!!

Just had a party at Will's Northwoods Inn for about 40 people.  Kevin, Colleen and all the staff were extremely helpful and accommodating to make sure everything went well.  We utilized the upstairs room as well as the outdoor area.  We served a combination of in-house appetizers and pizza, which they had no objection to us bringing in, even suggesting where to get it from.  Comments from our guests were all very positive as to our selection of Will's.  I don't live in Chicago, but would love to see a Packer's game there some time.  We would definitely recommend it for your party needs.
Loveeee love love will's! It's our local bar just a couple of blocks away from our apt so we frequent it often! Great food, service, and laid back atmosphere. :)
Awesome cheese curds. Loud and crowded on the weekend, but you can still carry conversations with people. Great staff and decent beers as well.
This place is great.  Nice staff and a wonderful beer garden.

Great neighborhood spot.  It is difficult to find a place in the area that is open for lunch during the week.  Food is decent, service is always exceptional.  This is just a fun place to be except if you're Bears fan and the Packers are on.  Friday Fish Fry was delicious and a good value, certainly better than the underwhelming portion at nearby Schubas.  I will definitely be back very soon.
My favorite place to watch Wisconsin sports in Chicago. Great atmosphere, good people and lots of beer.

I'll preface this review by saying I"ve never been to Wisconsin and I'm not a football fan. I was with a group of Wisconsin-natives and ultimate Packers fans, so to say, I was in good company.  This place was yummy! And thirst-quenching. And the decor was awesome because there was a giant moose head on the wall. Talk about a taxidermist's dream up in this place.  Good beer- lots of Leinenkugel.  Will say that their mixed drinks weren't that strong but they were really big. That was by far the biggest (and least strong) gin & tonic I've ever bought.  Had the cheese curds. UM YUM. Also had the hummus plate which was also tasty.  Overall, it was a really fun bar, although go at your own risk if you're not a Wisconsin football fan.
Gotta love the feel of the North Woods--  love this place for the atmosphere.  Great for a Packers game, but it gets very crowded, so arrive early.

It was Packers day against the Chicago Bears!  I was super excited for a couple of reasons:  One of my close friends who lived in Chicago was a HUGE Packers fan and I've never been to Chicago!  He told me about this place that goes bonkers and I was excited to check it out!! For a Packers game, you need to get there early!  We got there 4 hours before the game LOL.  You will not miss the place.  There's a huge statue of a Moose on the outside.  This joint is on the corner of Nelson and Racine.  Super convenient to get there.  This place reminds me of the perfect Packers bar:  Wooden panel walls, diner green hanging lights, Wisconsin and Packer plaques everywhere.  Kind of a sports bar as well, darts and stuff.  This location even has a big ten on the side for overflow.  Then, there's also an outside area with more room and where they grill the brats.  Such a chill place to be!  I felt like I was at home! During the game, they had a Miller Lite special.  You get this big Packers Memorabilia cup filled with Miller Lite for a bit more on your first round.  Then every refill is only $6.  You keep the cup.  We also had $4 Fireball shots.  You can tell it was going to a crazy night, so we also got some eats while we were there.  You can NEVER go to a Wisconsin bar without getting the fried cheese curds.  A basket costs $7.25.  Delicious beer battered curds and super flavorful, served with ranch.  Later in the game, I got the brats outside for $3.  Fill that sucker up with sauerkraut and you've got the best brats ever!  So juicy, so flavorful, so good! What a place!  I hope to be back the next time I'm in town.  Everyone was so nice.  The people who frequented this place were awesome as well.  Such a great atmosphere, you feel so comfortable.  Thanks Will's!!
I love Wills! Great neighborhood bar, decent beer selection plus a great patio in the summer :-)

It's hard to believe I could have even more good stuff to say about Will's, but I was just there yesterday and was sooooo excited to see that they've upgraded the disgusting bathroom towel to a hands free paper towel dispenser!!! Well done Will's, well done.
Great bar but HORRIBLE buffalo chicken wrap. 99% lettuce, 3-4 tiny pieces of chicken, 0 buffalo sauce. Would go back to drink but nothing more.
As of two weekends ago, Pumpking on draft!!!  Keep bringin the good beers, Will's!

Honestly didn't know what to expect, the reviews seemed great but when we walked in I kind of felt like I was in a small town bar which made me uncomfortable for various reasons. Luckily the place has a back room and this felt more open and inviting. Throughout the night the place started to fill up and that small town bar feel slipped away and it felt more like a neighborhood bar (yes in my mind these are two separate things). we were there for trivia which was fun but  takes longer than I would like between rounds.   Eats and drinks: I had a grilled cheese sandwich with grilled onions and tomato and fries. I enjoyed it and it wasn't overly greasy so I consider that a win. They have a fairly large selection of beer but most of them are Leinenkugel. The menu also mentioned that they proudly serve Barefoot wines...so you should try the beer :)

My favorite neighborhood bar, hands down.  It may help that I practically live here.  Listen, I am not from Wisconsin and am not a Packer/Badger fan... but it don't mean a thang.  I come here to watch football and sports all the time, and it's always a fun time.  One thing I have come to realize by my frequent visits, is how darn nice Wisconsin folk are! Sport rivalries can sometimes create real tension between people, but Bears Vs Packer games are really fun here, surround by Pack fans. So don't be intimidated if you're a Bears fan (like me). You'll be welcomed and have a great time. Now that i got all of that out of my system, let me talk about the staff.  The bartenders and servers here are great.  All super nice people, friendly, know their regulars, take care of everyone... So many good things to say about them.  The food is great too! Lots of bars have your typical bar bites, but this stuff is MUCH better.  I'm a sucker for fried pickles and they have some of the best I have ever had... not to mention they feed my wing addiction. It's a great spot for sports, a great place to meet friends and have a good time.

You know this is a great Wisconsin bar when you hear a Michigan alum say "I'll totally admit it, I've had a ton of fun at Will's." Will's is tucked away in the Lakeview neighborhood and you probably wouldn't look twice at it just walking by on a regular day.  But it definitely gets crowded on game days, so make sure to get there early if you want a spot to watch a TV.  I've not been for a Packer game, but have heard it's the same sort of deal. You're also pretty much guaranteed to run into people you know from Madison if you're a recent alum.  Good or bad, I'll let you decide.
Unreal bar. They really car about their customers. Free cheese crackers and meat at the bar, great specials, amazing bar food. Love Wills.

Fun outside patio in the summer, friendly people inside year-round. Will's may be considered a neighborhood bar, as it is a bit of hike through a very residential part of Lakeview, but it is worth the trip. Good fried food options, classic draught beer choices, and some of the friendliest people (staff and patrons) around.  The crowd is pretty consistent ranging from recently graduated Big Ten alums to... well other even more recently graduated Wisconsin alums, but perhaps there is something in the poutine that makes it worth coming back to time and again. Go to Will's to have a beer, throw some darts or maybe play pool; unless the Badgers are playing, in which case good luck getting in the door.

They have cheese curds. And Heidi. What more could a WI native ask for? Ok, so I'm not a WI native. But I have partied in Madison a few times and Will's ranks right up there with the best of the best of Madison. Great place to just chill on non-Badgers game nights and a blast from the college past on game day. Heidi is a great bartender and super friendly. Stop in and say hi!

I hosted a private party in the back room on Saturday night and I've got to say that it was the best experience I've ever had while hosting a party in Chicago. From booking the party to closing down the bar on Saturday night, the entire process was fantastic. Kevin and Rob were both so helpful with planning the event and catered to whatever we needed. The day of the party, every single staff member was so polite and did a great job helping us set up for the party. Literally every person (Bartenders, bouncers, bar backs, etc.) shook my hand and introduced themselves. Dan, our bartender for the night was great too; friendly, accommodating, and handled our rowdy crowd like a pro. The customer service at this place was above and beyond (it's probably because they hire so many nice folks from Wisconsin) and I recommend Will's to anyone that looking to host a party!
Badgers + cheese curds x running into random people you haven't seen since college = FUN!

I loved this place. It's just like a Northwoods bar. They have a great selection on the jukebox and the bartenders were friendly. I had a few Big Sky's Moose and some of their Leine's on tap. I also had the cheese curds and pickle spears and loved every bite. I bike a lot and try to keep fit playing some sports but deep inside I am a fat little Wisconsin fem who loves her fried foods. Try the Merkt's Cheddar Bacon Burger if you want to transport yourself back north. It's juicy, cheesey, humongous and priced right.  Best part is all of the Badgers stuff all over the walls. On, Wisconsin! On, Wisconsin! Thanks for the great time, guys!
There is a great atmosphere here. Friendly staff. Johnny cash and CCR.  And, great beer! 'Nuff said!

I've been to Will's on several occasions since my last review, and I have to say that  everything is perfect again.  Food, drinks, service, popcorn, Touchtunes machine I can control with my smartphone... It's all there...  Go to Will's for a great time.

I've been coming here since 2003 and if Yelp was around then it would have gotten five stars. Yet that hasn't stopped it from getting better every year.  The reason it's a great bar? Great people. Bar tenders, bouncers, bar backs, and managers. They treat everyone like regulars.  They treat everyone like friends. Oh by the way, great food and tap beer selection along with sizeable outdoor seating in the sun during the summer.  So if you are just looking for a good solid midwest bar with no pretense, Wills is it.

Love Will's Northwood's Inn.  A slice of Wisconsin goodness in the heart of Wrigleyville. Great atmosphere, great staff, fun for Packer, Badger, Blackhawk games. Fun events like Muskyfest, 5th quarter and Packerpalooza. The Lombardi Party Room is great for hosting events. Outdoor patio. Food is solid. Cold Beer. Love it when Pat McCurdy or the Greg Brady Experience show up and play live. GM Kevin Kruse makes it all happen. Will's is a treasure for anyone looking for a north wood's experience complete with good ol' Wisconsin hi jinks!  In fact, I'm not sure there is a bar north of the border as fun as Will's Northwood's Inn. We just need to find a way to dock our boats and blaze a snowmobile trail into 3030 N. Racine Avenue? Highly Recommend!
Great neighborhood bar.  It has a huge patio area so perfect for day drinking in the summer time.  The food is only OK.  I would select a different restaurant if your looking for a meal
Good beer selection, friendly staff, free popcorn, and a great outdoor beer garden. Definitely one of Chicago's hidden gems.

There's almost no reason a bar that offers free popcorn should get anything less than 4 stars (even if it is a Packer bar).  The deer antler light fixture hanging from the ceiling and other quirky props all over the bar really give this place the northwoods feel. I haven't tried their food, but the beer options are vast, including Leinie's Original and a house specialty beer.   Since it's a great option to watch games, I'll be back.

So Will's is just around the corner from my coach house so the roomies and I love to frequent here. The service is always great and the atmosphere is laid back. My roommate and I watched a basketball game there for several hours while enjoying beers and the bartender gave us a free round just for being there for so long. But the BEST thing about this bar is the Wisconsin CHEESE CURDS. My friends are always begging to go to Will's on a hungover Sunday morning to enjoy some curds and a beer.  Their Musky Fest in the summer is a blast too - definitely worth checking out. Live bands, Musky Queens, and lots of Leinies!

I loved this place.  Great atmosphere, it also really was just like a Northwoods bar.  Loved it!  Great crowd, great music on the jukebox and the bartenders were great!  I had the Will's Northwoods Inn Tap by Leines, really liked it.  I also had the fried pickle spears, perfection!  The cheese curds we had too were perfect, the batter was so good!  I will be back here!

Coming from a northern Wisconsin girl who is new to the city...Will's rocks! It's definitely my favorite bar in Chicago so far (and its not even football season yet). They have a great staff, awesome bloodys, good food and the atmosphere is totally my style. Whether your looking to watch some sports, shoot some pool, grab a bite to eat (the tuna melt is awesome) or just simply drink Will's is the place to be!

This place is so charming! As our neighborhood bar, Will's serves a few purposes: a place to grab a beer at the bar with some regular's dog at your feet, a spot to chow down on a great burger or brat on picnic benches next to a giant moose, and of course, a sports center for Wisconsin and Chicago games. We live 2 blocks away and we know without watching every time the Packers score; people line up outside starting at 8 a.m. It's fantastic to observe. I'm really glad you're here, Will's. Keep my barstool ready.

Excellent neighborhood bar! They have a great outside patio with TV's which makes it a great place to watch a sporting event. They also have darts and a pool table inside as well as TV's so it's a great place for sports year round. Big food menu, as well as a decent beer list. Excellent service, great place overall!

When you live in the city, sometimes you just want to escape to the Northwoods.   Just like a Wisconsin lodge, Will's is chock full o' kitschy Packers/Badgers/stuff you would find in a log cabin that creates a charming, cozy place to settle in for the game, or in my case, trivia.  With just the right amount of time in between questions to chat with friends, good music, and friendly bartenders, Tuesdays are a chill place to kick back.  Sundays are comedy open mics, which is enticing, as well as the cheese curds.  I'm sure that will become part of my future very soon.  On tap, there's a good mix of Wisconsin and Chicago brews, as well as a healthy selection of whiskey.  Not too crowded, not too empty, it was a Goldilocks night.

On Wisconsin!! This is the closest you are going to get to being in a Wisconsin Bar without actually being in Wisconsin. The food is great, the beer is cheap and game days for the Packers or Badgers are like none other. Be prepared to be cheek to cheek with the best fans in all of sports as it tends to get packed. I recently waited outside in 20 degree whether with more than 100 other people for almost an hour to get in when the Packers made the playoffs. This bar is more than worth the wait. If its a big game be prepared to arrive at least 6 hours early if you want to guarantee yourself a bar stool or table. Will's is definitely a little piece of God's country in the heart of Lakeview.

This is my go to favorite bar. Haven't been to any of the Packers events but my BF is a huge fan, so it's inevitable. The food I've had there. BLT - Great. Tater tots - Great. French fries - Great. Chicken sandwich- Not...great...pretty bad. Probably just an off day...? Today i decided to go in and try the southern food they have. A Wisconsin bar in Chicago, wasn't expecting TOO much. Chicken gumbo - Surprisingly actually really good. I prefer seafood gumbo but not being in NOLA or actually in the gulf, chicken is a good idea. The flavors were great, not TOO spicy but a nice bite, tasted authentic enough! My only complaint is there's too much STUFF in it, peppers, onions, celery, large chunks. If they made it the same but smaller dices, and less stuff, it'd be amazing! Served with the rice on top too. I was pleasantly surprised with it's flavor and authenticity. Fried pickle spears - I've had better. They were still pretty great (how can you go wrong?) But the pickles were a little shriveled and there was too much breading. Still good. Next up, must try the poutine!!! The service has always been decent-good. No complaints!  Came in with my dog and they didn't allow dogs inside (understandable) but did on the patio. Despite it being January, they served me out there (it was 52 degrees though!) And were nice. It was actually great sitting out there, just me and my dog, with a pipping hot bowl of gumbo, popcorn, a beer and control of the flat screen tv. Love this place. Love love love the free popcorn.

I play in the Wednesday night Euchre League at Will's, and thank god my friends taught me the game or I never would have discovered this awesome little neighborhood bar. The bar is really big, has good food and beer, and a really laid back atmosphere. I love the patty melt and the burgers. The cheese curds are just so so compared to curds I've had in Wisconsin, but oh well, beggars can't be choosers. When it's warm out, the patio is awesome. Definitely worth checking out.

Impressed!! (I guess my review didn't post in April 2012 when I had originally wrote it!) Night one of my our trip to Chicago and we stopped by for a drink. My family doesn't live too far from here so most of our night included family time... Needed to go somewhere close. WINNER.  People who work there, great sense of humor, very down to earth, makes me loath Los Angeles bars more and more.  Nice crowd, very busy, sports bar feel, but you can tell that there are a lot of regulars who love the place. Beer on draft... A pint is $4-$5.... And that's not just miller light or something.  They give you tastes tests of their different types of beer if you want to try something new, they check on you if you need anything. Overall, great place. Thanks guys for making day one of our night fun! :) P.S. after giving us tips on local places to check out, the bartender took a shot with us. Maybe I've had crappy experiences and service at bars before, but this place was a winner in my book!

I love you Will's so much.  I have been here a lot, and have never had a bad time.  The gm is a very nice guy, and the rest of the staff seems very nice as well.  It is especially fun when the Packers win!  Everyone goes crazy.

This is one of the well-established Packer/Wisconsin Bars in the city.  So bears fans stay away.  I came with the other students and it was a good experience.  The food was about average and the drink specials were nice and cheap.  They offer free popcorn when you sit at a table which was a plus, especially for starving students.  The atmosphere was definitely like being in the backwoods of Wisconsin, which was nice.  One huge disappointment was not having Spotted Cow Beer.  But other than that, it was a decent place, just not for Bears fans.
Great ambiance.  Give-aways during Packers game.  Fun staff.  Good beer specials. Overall, a very fun place to cheer on THE PACK.

LOVE THIS SPOT!!!!! Don't ever leave. I adore this place. Great food, great beer (thanks for selling cold Miller Lite!!!!!!!!) and amazing people, staff, and of course....showing Pack Attack games!!!!!!
had my wallet pick pocketed here, so be forewarned during hectic game days
Stopped in late, such a warm space. Reminds me of the rural Wisconsin bars.  Free popcorn. Great bartenders. Jim, I believe, was much fun.

Will's is a tough place to evaluate simply because the quality of the experience largely depends on the event going on.  As a Wisconsin football fan, I love being here for Badger games, but it can also be really overwhelming. What I can say is that the staff is friendly and they do a great job of pulling off the Northwoods theme.  All I recommend is that you check before going if there is an event of interest or an event that might interfere with what you're looking for before going.

How can you give a place in Chicago that specializes in the Packers less than 5 stars? They have huge plastic cups of Leine's on game day for only $7. BUT, refills are only $5! They let you bring in your own food AND drink from other establishments, they let you save tables for hours, they raffle off awesome Packers gear at halftime and they play all the music from Lambeau live in the bar. How can you go wrong?
Great neighborhood place.  Good staff, cold drinks.  What more does one need?  Food? They have it I just didn't try it.... yet.

Best Wisconsin-feeling oasis south of the cheddar curtain. This place feels like a pub that you would find after spending a day fishing in Eagle River/St. Germain, etc... the list goes on. Great food, daily drink specials, darts, free popcorn and an attentive staff. Kevin, Rob, & Brian are all classy ambassadors of hospitality for this gem of an establishment. Great place!

I often pass by this establishment when I am walking to and from the train.  I regularly peek inside to see all the patrons enjoying the bar and each others' company.  Last week I found out that my girlfriend of 3 years had been cheating on me.  I was suspicious because I started to form cold sores in and around my mouth and since I was not kissing anyone else, the illness had to be born from her body.  Well she convinced me that you can get that kind of sickness from kissing to roughly and loving someone too hard, so I believed her.  One day I followed her as she left the house to grab drinks with the girls, she ventured into the Will's Northwoods Inn.  As she passed the bar a young gentleman rose to meet her with a hug and a kiss on the lips.  As I watched from outside I saw her caress his wrist with her hand like an ocean wave meeting the bow of a ship.  I stood there watching them, envious of the gaze she paid his face.  A gaze I had not witnessed in the past 2 years.  We have since separated and I credit this bar with revealing the truth.  Thanks you Will's Northwoods Inn.
Great atmosphere, nice woodsy- lodge feel and the chili is probably the best around town. We found a winner!

Such a great place! I admit that I am a huge Badger and Packer fan so this place is just like being home in Wisconsin.  Their menu is great and includes all of my favorites ... being from Wisconsin I love the fried cheese curds and of course the brats. The service is great and friendly and all the people in the bar were super friendly. I will definitely be there on Sundays to watch the games with my Packer friends!

Live a block from this place and I'm so happy about it. I go all the time. The bar keeps are cool and theres a guy with longer hair that will check your credit card, memorize your name and call you by it each time you order which says a lot about the service at this place.  Really nice people.   Good food too, get the wings, quality stuff. Also a great packer bar during football season if that's what you are into. Have a Garden area as well. Cool place.

Love this place! I am overdue on this review, definitely. My wife and I are regulars, and the bartenders are awesome. Obviously not being Packers fans, this is place to avoid during NFL games (unless you are a Packers fan... in which case you should camp out to get into the bar for the game) I love poutine - and theirs uses delicious Wisconsin cheese curds - but almost every other time they are out of either curds or gravy, and it is heart breaking! I always want it.... maybe my cholesterol will thank them later. No reason to remove any stars, i guess.... Minus 1 star: complaints - or maybe just warnings to other Wills-goers - the bathroom needs a better hand dryer (the reusable cloth roller thing? is this an environmental thing or what? gross...) and there is one waitress *NOT a bartender - they all rock* that needs to try and lighten up. seems to always be wearing her grumpy pants. I don't necessarily love my job either, but I don't broadcast it 24x7. ***Update: I was contacted immediately after posting this by a GM - awesome of them! Apparently they are working to correct the poutine situation, the bathroom towels, and grumpy pants. So, I suppose I will bump it a star. Hope they pull through, however! ***UPDATE #2*** pulled through on their word, per usual. Will's is awesome.

Great neighborhood bar. I've been going up north since I was little and this place reminds me of the main bar we go to. I love that they have regular lienys and Point Special in bottles. The cheese curds are fantastic. If you're looking for a place to relax with some beers and not be hassled by annoying people then this is the place. Everyone who works here is really nice plus darts are free and REAL darts. Also they now have breakfast on weekends. Wills is def my go to bar for a beer

Will's Northwoods Inn is a true taste of Northern Wisconsin. Friendly patrons and a staff that will go out of their way to make sure you have an enjoyable experience!! If you're a sports fan for any WI team, this is the place to be on game day! During Packer and Badger football games they give away awesome prizes including the ever famous Game Bibs! The food is delicious and they have a Friday Fish Fry!! Free popcorn too if you're looking for a little snack while you sip a cold beer. My favorite neighborhood bar!

Throw on your most comfortable outfit and head out for a fun night at Will's.  On the walls you will find more Wisconsin-esque decor than you can probably stomach but that is part of the charm!  Everywhere you turn, there's a mounted fish.  Will's also offers pool, a juke box, a large patio, big booths, and free popcorn.  There are a variety of beers available at a low price.  This is one of my favorite places to go with a group of close friends.  You can sit at the bar and watch a game or find a booth and drink and talk for hours.  Heck, you can even make your own dance party around the juke box.  Sometimes, a local will show up around 11pm selling homemade tamales.  What more could you ask for?  Leave your heels at home and kick it with some homies in flannel.

Went to Will's on a Sunday night for a few beers.  Saw a sign for open mic night, so we wandered upstairs.... ** BONUS CONTENT: UNLOCKED ** ...We watched a solid 3 1/2 hours of free open mic stand-up comedy, most of which was really good.  I think over 75% of the audience is other comics (locals I've seen at other venues), but we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves in the front row.  I didn't need another reason to love Will's, but they gave me one anyways!
Favorite neighborhood bar! No drunk girls/girls stumbling around, popcorn and can usually get a sat somewhere. Patio in the summer is the best!
Love it here! Unfortunately, so does everyone else on game day.  It gets packed for Badger and Packer football, so be ready for a long beer line.

Pool table?  Yes! Dartboards?  Yes!  4 of em. Huge beer garden?  Yes! Huge moose in the beer garden?  YES! Great bartenders?  Yes! Will's has been taking care of me for a while now.  The bartenders there (Dan, Jim, and Rob, especially) will make the effort to learn your name, and the whole bar has a super friendly midwest feel. I Love Will's!

One of the best Wisconsin bars South of the state line. they have alot of dead critters on the wall they love to kill up there having no world class cities like Chicago. This is a good bar and I am sure there are hundreds of them up there as there is not too much to do in cheese land. They have a good supply of beer on tap and the decor is interesting compared to many of the other bars in the depaul area. I seen better bars in Chicago but not too many nore interesting or unique ones better than Will's woods.
Amazing. Green, Gold, and stuffed animals on the wall. Felt just like going home!

I literally felt like I was in Wisconsin while at Will's Northwoods. Fish fry...check. Beer...check. Bar Die...check. Starting with the fish fry. The fish was fried to perfection and the tartar sauce was unreal. Moving on to the beer. Will's has plenty of drink choices...all with different types of beer flavors.  Last, but not least, the bar die. If you go to any bar in the Wisco, you are given the opportunity to play the best drinking game of all time, Bar Die. It's such an amazing game, because the result is ALWAYS a round of shots for the participants. Will's has this game and the bartender was really good at it (which is why my tab was so freaking expensive).  Overall, this is a slamming place and if you like anything about Wisconsin or the Northwoods, you will love Will's. Boom Hey

Cheap beer... Free popcorn... Pub Trivia on Weds... check, check, and check.  Wills is a great place. They have a very large patio and cute decor (if you're into the whole woodsy type of thing).  The only negative is the gross ass towels to wipe your hands with in the ladies room... ugh.

As a Badger fan Will's is one of my favorite places to catch a game.  When you walk in you definitely feel like you're back in Wisconsin!  There's always a fun atomsphere and good specials.  The only downside is that they don't serve food, though many times they have free burgers and hot dogs during the game.  It's a fun neighborhood bar and is worth checking out if you like the Badgers or Packers.

I'm definitely Not a Packer fan (Bears fan woot woot!), but I really like this bar. I have been here on 2 occasions. You may wonder why a Bears fan has been here twice. Well this Bears fan is also a good girlfriend. The bf is a Packers fan and he really wanted to come here. The first time was for the Superbowl last year. We arrived about a hr before the game and it was already packed! We were able to find one chair by the bar. They grill burgers and brats in the back for $2 each. You can't beat that! You can get a big old cup of beer for $7 and $5 for refills with the same cup. The 2nd time I was here was this past weekend for the Bears and Packers game. The bf and I were running late and we got there right when the game started. I took a risk and wore my bears shirt. I gotta tell ya I was kind of scared. Most people were nice, but of course there were some drunk ignorant people. It also felt good to know that there were other fans in the building. Just a tip come extra early for any big Packer game because you will be standing the whole time.
You have to be a serious jerk to not give Will's 5 stars. This is the best place to see the Bears/Packers games each year in Chicago.
Nothing cures my homesick for america's dairyland like this spot. This is THE badger bar! Great bar Fantastic staff!
Home away from Home.  Go Pack!!

Will's is a great spot to go and unwind with some friends either on the patio outside or indoors for some free popcorn and darts! I find the people there to be one of a kind as well. Rarely do you ever encounter some yuppies or meat heads-just good ol' fashioned, fun peeps. My first experience there was a great one. It was in the Winter of 2008 and my friends an I took a picture next to the large Indian statue inside. Good times had by all. Popcorn could use a lil less salt though...

I am not a Packer or Badger fan but this place is Camp Randall South.  Great place, awesome decor inside, tons of great beers, and the beer garden is one of the best in Chicago. There is a cougar, a moose, a deer, fish among other things on the walls at Will's.  It has Summer Shandy and Coor's Batch 19 on tap, which is SWEET! Played a random game of Flip Cup outside which was great and it doesn't get any better than the gigantic Moose outside. Love this place.

I feel like I should finally review Will's after multiple visits...ok, a few of them were late nights, but now that I've also been there earlier, for food and also for a baby shower (yes, I said baby shower)....I feel it's time to get on to reviewing. Aside from the whole Wisconsin tie (I suppose it's not the worst state...), this is a dive worth diving in to (lame statement...I know!). Anyway, Will's is a no-frills spot on an easy to miss corner in a mostly residential area a bit south of Belmont.  Parking may or may not come easily (I recommend not driving there anyway), but once inside, you'll be glad you visited. Cheap beer, pool, a patio and a friendly staff?  What more can you want?  The vibe is friendly and very laid back.  I really like the patio area (aside from the last time I visited...when it was about 9,000 degrees).   Don't come here for a polished atmosphere or 5-star cuisine - come for friends, fun and some drinks (and pretty tasty bar food).   I have to take them down a notch in my scale for 2 reasons...both regarding the bathroom.  First of all, I'm not sure how any female can use the bathroom because the stalls are basically the most miniscule things I've ever seen.  Secondly, please upgrade to hand dryers versus those gross fabric things.  I'm pretty sure those are extinct now (and have been for 20 years). Anyway, I'll be back!

Came here to watch a Marquette game without standing in an hour-long line first (Schoolyard...).  This place is great!  If you've been searching for the hole in the wall, north woods Wisconsin bar, this is it.  Or, it's as close as you'll get to it without driving 8 hours north.   Cheese curds, drink specials.  Pretty sure that's all you'll ever need.

Bottom Line Up Front: The whole town knows I had an awesome time. My friends had a party here during Fourth of July weekend in the Beer Garden. The weather was beautiful and a flip-cup tourney broke out. As a result my review will be completely lacking in relevant details. From what I remember the Beer Garden was BIG... like, empty lot big. Lots of picnic tables and room to spread out with their cheap beer specials.  The rest of the night was a little hazy. I remember a stuffed moose head and I can give a detailed description of the men's room toilet/tile floor, but not much else. I suppose you should view this positively, because it is an indication of how much fun I had (admittedly at the staff's expense - thanks for cleaning up, guys).

I have absolutely no connection to Wisconsin or the Packers (aside from hoping to marry Aaron Rodgers along with thousands of other women), but I love this bar. A kicked-back vibe, cheap beer, free popcorn, strong drinks, green and yellow everywhere (I'll pretend its for my Oregon Ducks), free darts, and cheese curds--whats not to love?   And during warm months, the beer garden is a perfect place to kick back and watch the game (like I need to tell you what game that would be). Rabid insanity on game days, but a super chill and friendly crew of people on any other night. So yes, non-Wisconsinites (I don't even think that's the correct term), Will's can be for you as well.
I'm the Musky Queen so I may be a tad biased, but Will's is a great place any time or day! Especially good for Trivia Girl every Tuesday and Badger and Packer games.

Had that Merkt's burger with Merkt's cheddar cheese and bacon which was pretty good.  Only complaint is that the bacon seemed like it was cooked hours before and was just sittin' there prior to being applied to my burger.  The cheese more then made up for this. This place has a pretty cool atmosphere and an outdoor patio as well.

The atmosphere here is definitely unique.  Large plastic woodland creatures, strange light fixtures, and huge stuffed (used-to-be-alive) animals make for an unconventional scene.  However, since it's quite far off from where we live, I don't think it would be worth the trek for a night out.  This is mostly because while the food is good, I think it's kind of overpriced.  I mean, we ordered fried cheese curds which were DELICIOUS mind you, but for $7 an order, I was expecting WAY more of them.  That said, they were crispy on the outside, creamy on the inside and had a distinct beer flavor, so it's still A-OK in my book.  Best feature here is the patio.  Lots of great seating options, it's huge, and the lighting is great!
I felt like i was walking into one my parents favorite wisconsin bars, but no it's in chicago! the parents would be proud. the bartenders pour some tall drinks and are quick on refills.

I frequent Wills about once a week for lunch, gotta love the cheese curds and wings. But the best part of having lunch there is the great service.  Ziel, the gal behind the bar is AMAZING.  She's attentive, funny and just an overall great bartender.  She's filling your glass at the exact moment you were to ask for one.  For Wills being a neighborhood bar I would go there over any other place for some good snacks and GREAT service!

Will's is hands-down the greatest Packer and Badger bar outside the great state of Wisconsin. It also happens to be dangerously close to my apartment, and one of my favorite places to drink away a summer afternoon. The place is packed during any Wisconsin game, but still manages to be reliably friendly and fun. If you're a semi-recent UW grad, you're guaranteed to run into at least 3 familiar faces from the streets of Madison. Thought you'd never see that Friday-night 'Brats dance partner again? Joke's on you. If they live in Chicago, they're here. This leads to lots of happy, hilarious, and only sometimes awkward, reunions.  An aquarium of lake fish, hunting trophies, wood paneling and northern memorabilia lend to the northwoods theme. It could easily be mistaken for the basement of any of my Wisconsin family members (though they only dream of having several delicious beers on tap).  Will's is also a great stop when it's not in a WI sports frenzy. Free darts and popcorn, a Euchre league and excellent beer specials make a perfect casual hangout. The expansive and comfortable beer garden has TVs, which staff will change to any channel you request. PLUS Will's has the best cheese curds I've found in northern Illinois, besting Culver's. If you go during a Wisconsin game, keep your cup! The first beer is $7, with refills at $5. I've been drinking out of the same Will's cup for a year and a half and saving a few dollars every time. Hooray for dishwashers, and hooray for Will's.
I used to go here more often.  Recent changes and addition of kitchen are really nice.  Great patio and staff is typically awesome
Great place to enjoy a Wisconsin Badger or Packer game.  I entertain the fans here on trumpet as they sing along.... Fun place!

Hands down, without a doubt, my favorite bar in the city!  I am normally a wine bar/lounge bar kind of girl too, so that says a lot.  I have NEVER not had a good time at Will's.   It is the place to watch all Wisconsin Badgers and Green Bay Packers games.  They even have a free raffle during half time of every game.  Everyone is always is a great mood there and it is really easy to meet people and make new friends there.  I would recommend this bar to anyone!

If this bar could, it would bleed Wisconsin cheese.... not sure what that means, but it totally applies. From animal heads mounted on the walls, to tumblers of beer, grilled brats and cheese curds, to a life sized moose loitering in the patio, Wills is a Wisco Oasis in the middle of Chicago Land. It's a safe haven for those of us who needed a big city, but refuse to succumb to the Chicago Bear's fan club (GO PACK!) and still appreciate the coziness of home.  If you miss Madison on Badger Game Days and the Stadium Bar for all its college belligerence, Wills packs in a sea of red and white. When you crave a simple, yet exciting Sunday Football (GO PACK!) gathering of friends, Wills fires up the grill, serves up some Bloodies and cures the hangover. And if you find yourself homesick for the North Woods summer getaways, Wills supplies Musky Days.  We all know Wisconsin is awesome, and luckily someone brought a little piece of it down to Chicago. So go buy a Miller Light and show your appreciation. And again, GO PACK!

I hate the Packers and I'm not a Wisconsin fan. Yet, somehow, this is one of my favorite bars in all of Chicago. I come for the weekly trivia in the winter time. I love the atmosphere and the lodge-type feel here. There is enough wood paneling to make an Irishman happy. Of course they have tater tots as well. I have yet to be here on a Fall Saturday or Sunday, due to my sports teams allegiances, but I've heard quite the stories. Great place.

There should be a Bears bar like this in Chicago! But...it's a Wisco Bar...so Badgers and especially Packer games are HUGE here.   Fans really get into it...dressin up as clay matthews (wig and all), everyone gets a ticket at the door for raffle at half-time...they serve up cheeseburgers and brats outdoors for 2 BUCKS and it's good...where can you get food for 2 bucks at a bar in Chicago on game day!!!!   The outdoor area is like a big tailgate......and this year the heisman trophy stopped by....and one more thing...I don't mean to tell on anyone, but the bartenders hoook it up!  So tip em well! The folks at Will's really make this bar special special, unique and a great party atmosphere....non like I have ever seen.

This is a great neighborhood bar and has an amazing patio. I would have given them five starts but they are a packers bar and I am by no means  a packers fan. Anyway I have been here a few times, usually just for a late night drink, but I recently went for lunch. Everything was great, the staff was friendly, and even the regulars were welcoming.  They also have some good beers on tap and some good specials through the week. If you haven't gone your missing out, and if you are a packers fan you will pro fall in love with this place.

I'm a huge Packers fan, so I try to catch a game here once or twice a month.  It's a great place and an amazing atmosphere, but I have one major concern.  On more than one occasion, I'll start a tab at the bar and when it's time to close out, its way higher than it should be.  Yesterday, I had 4 beers and no food, and when it was time to close out, my tab was $45.  (And no, I wasn't so drunk that I just forgot how much I had).  It's extremely uncomfortable to try to explain to your bartender (when there are 4 or 5 different people serving you throughout the day) that your tab shouldn't be this high.   I'm not sure if the bartenders are padding the tab or other patrons are adding stuff after overhearing my name, but this has got to stop.   This has happened twice in my last 3 visits.  Other than that, it's a great place.  GO PACK GO!

Nestled deep in the heart of enemy territory, Will's provides us Wisconsinites a respite from all the horrible Bears fans - and introduces us to hundreds of people who know what you mean when you ask for the bubbler. This is the best bar. The drinks are cheap, the TVs are big, and the cheese curds are squeaky. GO PACK GO.

love this place! before i actually lived in chicago, i came here once with a group of friends. we didn't actually know the name of the bar, so to us, it will always and forever be known as "moose bar". why? because there's a giant moose outside. makes sense, right?  now i happen to live right around the corner (stalkers take note)  from moose bar and pop in every now and then for an after work drink. they apparently now serve food, but i haven't tried anything except the yummy extra salty popcorn while tipsy. great summer beer garden, lots of nice people and good prices. moose bar=win.

I had the fortunate experience of attending the Viking Packers game here last year and had a blast of a time.  As a Bears fan I did not have a true interest in this particular game...I just enjoyed the lively crowd hoping Brett Favres head would roll across the tv.
