It was very crowded but friendly group.  Beer specials were very reasonable and allowed a purchase the cup with discounted refills option.   The staff was friendly and the bar allows for you to bring in food or order and have it delivered here.  A good time was had by all...to bad I missed both of these games this year.

The food was very decent! We ordered the cheese curds and they were pretty amazing, and the Cobb Salad I ordered was fresh and tasty. The cabin-in-wisconsin decor is charming and inviting in a way.  That being said, the service was AWFUL. AWFUL.  There is some bartender that works there who was all kinds of rude to us for no reason. She seemed to huff and puff because we chose to sit at a table and she had to walk around the bar to serve us...she was seriously pouting. The worst part was halfway through our meal she stormed over and told us we had to "close our tab" because she was leaving. Fine. As we settled up mid-meal, though, she lingered over our table as we're tipping her which was uncomfortable and pretty much a no-no you learn the first day in Waitressing 101. On top of that, she didn't even leave and instead ruined our meal with her incessant yelling and over-the-top weird jokes. I've lived in Chicago for two years now and this was the worst/most uncomfortable service situation I have experienced yet.  Will's Northwoods seems like a fun bar with great food, but they need to reevaluate their staff situation because this chick was beyond terrible. I encourage anyone craving authentic fried cheese curds to stop by Will's for a brew, just make sure the loud-mouthed girl bartender isn't working.

I suppose if you are looking for an authentic Wisconsin experience you can get it here.  All that is missing are the pull tabs. This is the type of place that is good to experience once in awhile to remind you why you pony up for nicer places.  And I feel it is important to have those experiences once in awhile.

You can take the girl out of Wisconsin but you can't take the Wisconsin outta the girl! Recently moved from Wisconsin to Chicago and actually live less than 3 minutes away from this beauty of a bar! Never have I ever felt more welcome in a bar, than this one. Although, crowded (very crowded) at times, it is still just awesome. I feel like I am in a cabin in the middle of the woods and not some bar in the middle of Chicago. Did you see the size of that Moose?! You can't go wrong with this bar. Packer Sundays, Trivia Tuesdays, Two dollar High lifes on Tuesdays, STEEL tip darts AND FREE POPCORN? What more could a person want out of life?? Also, game day specials for Packers/Badgers games. $5 souvenir cups of beer, $2 brats/burgers and the awesome cheese and sausage tray! NOM NOM. I'm in LOVE.

Will's is a relaxed neighborhood bar with a "leave your ego at the door" attitutude.   Drinks are cheap, people are cool, they have darts, no one is to uptight there, the bar tenders are pretty cool.    It's busy during any Badgers game or Green Bay game, they do a nice job dealing with the crowd.

I was born an Iowa Hawkeye fan and I bleed black and gold but gosh dang it this Wisconsin bar is so much fun! Since moving from Iowa to Chicago the number of Wisconsin folks I've become good friends with is rather astonishing. Good people I tell ya. I've been one of probably two people in this bar donning Iowa gear during an Iowa vs. Wisc game but I've always felt welcome by patrons young and old.  The place can get insanely busy, we're talking body to body during Wisconsin games and Packer games (yes, I'm a Packer fan!) so getting their early (and I mean early!) is in your best interest during those games. Getting drinks from the bar has never taken me too long though, people who come early to stake out a spot at the bar before the big games are always regulars happy to help you squeeze in for a cold beer. The bar even hands out cheese and sausage trays during Packer games! Great way to make friends by sharing a piece of cheese and a Ritz!  The place goes crazy during games. Team chants, cheap burgers and brats (long lines for these), the whole nine yards. They have drink specials everyday of the week, some that pair up with trivia nights, etc. All Badger and Packer games have $5 32oz. cups of Miller Lite and Leinenkugel's.  Even for an Iowa girl, and looking at the rest of my family, a should be Bears fan, this Badger/ Packer bar is the cream of the crop in the city of Chicago.

I really don't want to like this place. It is dirty, smelly, and the bathrooms are disgusting.   HOWEVER... they do have the following: super friendly bartenders, back room that can be reserved for private parties, cheap drinks, darts, and country music if you are into that sort of thing.

I'm not a Packer fan (nothing against them) and was at Will's for a Packer game and had a BLAST! Tons of diehard fans here standing in any spot they can find (the place was packed) to watch the game and hang out. It was a ton of fun and the crowd was really nice and friendly. I want to go back on a weekend night to check out the scene, and I have a feeling I will like it just the same. Definitely a good bar to check out if you're in the area (or a Packer fan).
Really crowded for packer games. No indoor seats unless you get there by 930. Then you stand the whole game. Big outside area opened for games if warm.
Will's is more of a Wisconsin bar than any Wisconsin bar. It's a character of its origins...all the more reason to engage in the escapism and strap on the cheese bra and go!

Will's is a great place to stop by for a few minutes or several hours with friends.  The inside is is decorated like a North Woods hunting lodge and there is usually a group of middle aged men in the corner who are probably pretending they're on a fishing trip.  The beer garden outside is great and there are plenty of tables of all different sizes, even for large groups. Tuesday specials include $2 PBR bottles, $2 High Life bottles, $4 Guinness and $5 Jack drinks.  There is always unlimited free popcorn, and although it is the saltiest popcorn I've ever in my life, is still good and free!  They recently started serving food which is definitely a plus. The service is usually good- the staff will bring your food outside or come out to ask if you want the TV, etc.  I especially like it because it's 2 blocks from my apartment... a great place to hang out!

I love the idea of a Badger bar, or anything Wisconsin-themed.  It's a fun northwoods-themed place, and feels a lot like any small town Wisconsin bar in terms of decor and kitsch. What's not awesome is how incredibly crowded it is, and how insanely loud they play the games.  I really wanted to enjoy the WI-UNLV game last weekend, but I was pretty miserable since the TV was so loud (I promise I'm not a big baby - several other patrons were holding their hands over their ears too).  Lines for the bathrooms were extra long since they're all single-stalls, and it's hard to even tell where the line is since the whole place is so packed.  They can't possibly be abiding fire codes here, with how many people they let into the small space. Also - they have a raffle at half time.  The announcer is so annoying, and loud, and it takes forever for people to bring their # up since the place is so crowded.  I don't know how it's possible, but they were definitely calling numbers roughly 1-1000... and if that means there were 1000 people at Will's I almost believe it. Like I said, it has a fun theme, and a couple hours before the game it's great.  I'd 100% rather be watching it in my living room though, which is a pretty harsh statement coming from me, since I hate sports and bars/drinking is really the only thing that usually salvages it for me. All in all, this is the last place I'd want to be in case of a fire or ecological disaster.

A Badger bar in the heart of Lincoln Park. This place sponsored my spring kickball team and had great specials for us. Things get crazy for Badger hockey, basketball, football, ect. games so expect to be surrounded by drunken nonsense. The service is generally great and the patio is hopping in the summertime. I wish Will's was in the South Loop so I could come here more than a few times year.

Sometimes the August heat gets to me and I just wanna be kickin' on a Wisco lake with a cold Leinie and the loons a-calling. Then I shake out of it and grab a beer at Will's. Pros: Taxidermy A giant friggin' Moose in the side yard Cheap burrs Free popcorn. POPCORN! They got a pool table too. Muskyfest (and the crowning of the musky queen... raaaar) Cons: No food (well, minus frozen 'zas cooked in a toaster oven) Gets crowded Packers fans Far from pub trans More Packers fans But honestly, if you wanna get Northwoods action without having to drive to Sheboygan (let alone spell Sheboygan) swing by Will's ol' drinking hole. Just don't try to ride the moose.

This review is really easy to write.  I love this place like no other. A bar is a bar... and then you realize it's really about the people and I've met a lot of great people there. Will's is an oasis in Lakeview.  It's an honest to goodness neighborhood restaurant that caters on the weekends in the fall and winter to fans of the University of Wisconsin Badgers and The Green Bay Packers.  It's been a great place to watch Blackhawks games the past couple of years. They are known for their very friendly attitude and how much they give to their patrons for free during game days.  Beside the cheddar cheese and summer sausage sandwiches on Ritz crackers, they have FREE brats and burgers and a half time raffle giveaway. They have a $5 32 ounce cups of Miller or Leinies.  They have a daily drink specials.  Recently, they opened a kitchen and there are a lot of Wisconsin type foods on the menu like brats, deep fried cheese curds, a Badger burger and lots of other restaurant-bar standards! They just started wait service last week and so they'll be working the kinks out and I imagine they'll do their best to make it awesome in the next couple of weeks. The decor of the bar is Northwoods Wisconsin hunters paradise.  You'll see a lot of taxidermy on the walls including a couple of Moose, a bobcat, and their primary fish, the Musky.  There is also a lot of memorabilia from Badger and Packer teams and players in the past. They have a bunch of special events throughout the year.  There's always a chili cook-off on Superbowl Sunday which I haven't won... yet. They host a weekly euchre night on Wednesdays which gets a lot of action.  At the end of the Summer they have a block party called "Musky Fest" where they crown a "Musky Queen" and have lots of live bands.  It's a free and fun event.

I don't know what to say about Will's. I've been there twice, and both were not good experiences. But the staff are all really good people, and they work their asses off to make the bad things right. But...there's just way too many problems. To be fair, I don't give a damn about Wisconsin any more than any other state. Maybe a homesick Packer-Backer would overlook a lot for the sense of familiarity. People obviously love this bar. The first visit was a lazy Sunday afternoon, and the less said, the better. The manager did a great job of hearing out our complaints...none were present on our second visit. We thought a Friday night with the playoffs on might be more this bar's speed. The crowd was great -- a bit older and more subdued than our favorite sports spots. The servers were sweet (and surprisingly gorgeous), but completely overwhelmed. My wife got someone else's dinner, they kept forgetting the soda for the non-drinkers, and our cocktails got smaller and weaker as the night went on. We chose to leave early to finish the game elsewhere. The Badger burger was pretty good, but it wasn't enough. It seems like if you catch this place at the right time, it could be great. But, we've visited when it was empty, we've been back when it was busy (but not really slammed)...I'm not sure we're going to keep experimenting. And I'm actually a little sorry for that.
Great place for darts! This place has a lot of character and is pretty big. Decent beer selection and the food was good, typical bar food.

They serve food now and it isn't too shabby. I got a burger and opted to make it "spicy" and it sure was. The food comes out in a paper basket with tater tots on the side, which is a nice way to change things up from the normal plate with fries.  The best part of this place is the FREE popcorn. Yes, it is the saltiest popcorn I have ever had, but it keeps you thirsty for more beer and creates more cheers.  The fish tank in the front brings you right into the "up north" atmosphere. Then you go out back and are joined by huge statues of a bear and a moose.

If you are from Wisconsin and feeling homesick...This is the place for you...If you could give a fuck about the Packers, then not so much. Seriously, the walls are covered with dead fish and animals just like you would see at some hunting lodge in Wisconsin....Not to mention the giant statue of a moose in their beer garden. Yes, they have a rather large beer garden with a fireplace if I recall. Otherwise, its a fairly typical Lakeview sports bar which always has some baseball game on so that isn't my thing. They do have a couple of dart boards in the back as well as a popcorn machine which is nice.  Parking blows!

Update, yee-haw!  So I'm bumping Will's back up to 5 stars. Last year, we had my 30th birthday in the Lombardi party room. This past weekend my friend's celebrated a joint 30th birthday and elected to use Will's again for the following reasons: 1. The staff has been nothing but super nice every time we are there. They even let us put on the Ohio State vs. USC game last year for my birthday and the place is a freaking Wisconsin bar! 2. It costs nothing to reserve the party room. NOTHING. We learned last year that finding a place with a private room that doesn't require a minimum or a charge for the room is darn near next to impossible. 3. Although they now have a food menu (woowee!), you are allowed to bring in your own food. Thus making it easy for me to bring 2 dozen cupcakes from Molly's bakery, and others to bring crock pots of sloppy joes. 4. In the Lombardi room you have your own private bathrooms!

If you didn't know any better, a stumble into Will's might lead you to believe you've landed in the middle of Wisconsin.  There are enough cheese state accents, mounted animal heads, and Packer games on the TV to make it so.  It's Lakeview's only hunting lodge.   I wouldn't go so far as to call it a gimmick bar, but all of the above make Will's enough of an attraction to pull in plenty of our northerly neighbors and local sightseers to keep the place in business.

This place is AMAZING for Trivia on Tuesday nights! The owner is awesome and certainly seems to genuinely care that you have a great experience in his bar. The drink specials are outstanding. And if you place first or second on Trivia, they take care of your tab.  And...they have EUCHRE night! I don't know about you, but I love bars that offer game nights like Will's does. And they are usually very well attended without being overwhelming.  Unless there's some special event, like a sports game or a holiday, the place is pretty mellow and not too crowded. Very lodge-y feeling inside. Lots of wood and animal heads. Lots of tables and space too!  I love the outdoor seating in the summer time and the darts in the backroom.  I know it's odd, but even the mini pizzas they serve are good.  It's no fancy bar. It's just a great neighborhood pub for those of us who live nearby and enjoy a mellow bar with a giant looming moose standing guard over us from the patio.
Pros:  Will's has darts.  Will's has delicious popcorn.  Will's has several mooses.  I have never had a bad time at Will's.  And I'm not even from Wisconsin. Cons:  I would not poop in the bathroom.

My favorite bar in Chicago!  I come here for Packers games and free trivia night on Tuesdays.  They don't serve food but rumor is they are going to be installing a kitchen by this summer.   Unless you are a regular though, you may have a hard time getting a spot at the bar during their busier times.  My suggestion is, if you are going in to watch a sporting event or play trivia, get there early to get a table.

I've been through Lincoln Park Zoo and Wrigleyville millions of times and have gone up and down through crazy town watching legitimate idiocy here there and around the block five times. A few weeks ago I went through Yelp to compile a list of darts with corkboards that I have not yet visited and Will's Northwoods Inn was on TOP of the list. Great reviews, detailed web site with excellent pictures, a Packers bar? So what? Football season is over! After hitting up the all-you-can at Durkin's, I convinced six friends to follow me out to Will's Northwoods Inn and we got to the back area to play darts. Unfortunately the tables had reserved signs everywhere even though no one was there. We began to shoot darts and the bar darts were actually sharp. The corkboards were in good to excellent condition with the center board being the best. The scoreboard was the smooth plexiglass with white pencil and damp towel - great! The came in the birthday party, a manager let us know that they reserved the table and that we would have to move, the birthday girl was nice enough to let us stay so it was not a problem. We continued to play darts and I enjoyed the decor from the giant ass moosehead mounted up on a far off wall and the giant overhead collection of antlers that hung over the darts. There is a feeling that you're in a cabin when you're at Will's Northwoods and it's rather comfortable. Despite their comforting trappings, the people that reserved the party prove to me why the next generation of people coming out of college will be designated: The Dumbest Generation. One girl was telling the other girl, "Get the %#$!$ out of my face! I %@%!%! hate you!" A very unattractive one kept trying to hit on my friend and would not leave us alone!!! After I asked what she thought of that fact he had a girlfriend she snapped back at me, "I don't see any ring, what the $R!$@! do I care?!" Arrogant, bunk, and full of self-entitlement, I was ready to run her through with a dart right then and there! Then as we threw darts the Lakeview DePaul trash did not give us an inch to throw. Very bad dart etiquette as we had no space to play and people found it inconceivable that we brought out own darts and kept asking us to use our darts that we brought to the bar even though there was a set of bar darts (that were sharp mind you) I just wanted to scream!!!!!! I went to the back bar to get a glass of water to calm down. Nope, surrounded by idiots from the party and no bartender in sight after five minutes. GREAT! Fury just reached a new level and I couldn't stand it anymore!!!! I was trapped in a sea of college kids and had no way out! Bars are a business and people can choose to run their business any which way they like. You can't control who walks into the bar or how they behave. I spend more time than I should in bars and my favorite bars are where the owner will come out, chit chat with people about anything and everything. These are the bars I come into time and time again across winter, spring, summer, autumn, and back again because I know the people that run it are great people and friendly as hell and I am willing to tolerate the bs because of it. After finishing up a match of darts I moved me + 6 over to yet another dart bar. Playing darts is my favorite hobby, but I will have to try to come back when it is less crowded!

This a late post as I am new to yelping. I was in Chicago at Will's back in April of 09' after a Cubs game and dinner at Gino's. 1st off I am a huge fan of neighborhood bars like this. This place made me feel right at home even being that I live now in Orlando, Fl. Plus I was with some friends who had never been to Chicago before so taking them to a place that was LOCAL like this, was perfect. Not to mention a great story. As we got there it was still kinda early and I think a bachelor party was going on.  There were 8 of us sitting at the bar right inside the door. Well one or both gentlemen (a loosely used term here for people not in our group) next to us had very obnoxious gas. So I got up and moved over near the counter where you walk up by the door for some fresh air. So there I sat in my Cubs jersey, Green Irish Cubs hat, plaid shorts, flip flops, minding my own business enjoying a drink , when a series of people walk in and hand me their drivers license. So of course I look at it and hand it back (my improv training working out). One of the couples from Orlando with us are police officers and they thought that it was funny because I always say how I feel at home in Chicago and needless to say without anything being said people start handing me their license when they walk in the door. So this goes on for about an hour when my buddies wife (one of the police officers) walks over and asks if I am even looking at the date. I say no I am not a cop or a doorman but yes. So for about 1.5 hours I look at everyone who walks in driver license without once asking to see it. So my point is, This could only happen in a neighborhood bar that welcomes everybody and makes you feel at home, Whether your from Chicago, Wisconsin, Minnesota or Florida you'll be right at home in Will's
I went to college in Wisco and this bar does a damn good job of making me feel like I'm still there.  I absolutely love this bar for its unpretentiousness and it's love of everything Wisconsin.

wow. even though my previous review gave four stars and spoke highly of the bar and staff, the general manager read what had happened with the angry old man and took action! i received a message letting me know that not only had he spoken with several of his staff and the offending patron regarding the incident, but that i was welcome in my steelers gear any time! he even offered to buy my next beer!  and THAT, my friends, is how you run a bar. a huge thank you to kevin, andy, and the rest of the will's staff- i'll see you for the playoffs!

First let me establish my bona fides... I was born in Wisconsin and I lived there, in and around Green Bay, for 18 years. I went to Vince Lombardi Middle School and my mom now lives up in the real northwoods of Wisconsin (almost the U.P.). So I think I'm qualified to judge a place's Wisconsinness. Will's is as Wisconsin as you can get without making a trek north of the border. Lots of wood, dead animals. Packers stuff, UW stuff. One of those cloth towel thingies in the bathroom that no one likes. The only way you can tell you're in Chicago is 1. you can breathe (you can still smoke in bars in Wisconsin...yuck) and 2. the prices. But I don't think they could even pay their rent if they charged real northwoods prices here! This is the place to go in Chicago to watch a Packer game, if you can take the crowds. It does get packed! If you want a table, go several hours before kick-off. However, despite the crowds you could still generally navigate around, get into the bathroom, and get drinks from the bar (if you're willing to lean over some strangers). With the exception of one tool (who probably should be medicated) and his friends (see Bailey H's review) everyone was pretty nice. This is a bar, not a bar and grill and they do not sell food. During Packer games they grill out brats and burgers and hot dogs, but you have to wait out in the cold to get them and there can be lines...but there is a big flat screen TV outside so you can continue to follow the game. Also, from what I saw the burgers came off on the rare side, so if you like a well-done burger I wouldn't eat these. But hey, it's free! Just be aware this isn't a restaurant. I can safely say now that I've discovered this little piece of "back home" right here in Chicago, I'll be visiting again. Too bad they don't have a bubbler.

Update** 3.25.10: went here a couple of weeks ago with some co-workers and had a nice time. a bartender off duty bought us many rounds of drinks (always a good thing).. However, the leini honeyweiss was flat.. like unmistakably flat.  It was hard to cope with being my all time favorite brew on tap.  A fight also broke out in the bathroom and i saw some guys butt crack emerging from the stall.  I s'pose a little butt crack never hurt anyone.. Unflatten the Leini's Will's, and you'll forever hold a piece of my liver.   i really like this bar.  it's got a great neighborhood feel, pool & darts, and my beloved leini's honeyweiss on tap.  i wish i could remember the bartender's name who served us, because he was awesome.  Upon opening a tab, i asked if he could remind me to close it before I left.   I have a tendency for leaving my credit cards at the bar, especially after having a few drinks at Coopers prior (see review).  Anyway, the bartender was on top of his game, and not only was quick to fill up my glass, but made the extra effort to chase me across the bar to make sure i did not leave without it.   much love.
packed or not (during a game, always packed), it's a friendly and homey bar with an authentic northwoods feel.   so truely wisconsin, i'd expect someone's mom to get on the bar and start dancing.

I'm a Wisconsin native, and this was like going home. Of the HUNDREDS of people in the bar, I counted four people who were not wearing badgers apparel, two of which I had come with. It was packed. Like, can barely navigate from one place to the other with extra large novelty beer cups in your hands. That being said, it was a great bar. Free burgers and brats (however the line for food was RIDICULOUSLY LONG) and free popcorn makes this the bar to be at. The other great thing was the plate of cheese curds, crackers and summer sausage being placed on each table. Beer wasn't cheap, but it wasn't overpriced either. Everyone was friendly, and all around great atmosphere. I recommend it.

I was honestly surprised by this bar. The outside of it seems like a like local bar that you wouldn't give a second glance to (I'm surprised there wasn't an 'Old Style' sign that said packaged goods.) Huge moose aside, it looks funny. My friend moved down the street last weekend and between running to the truck and his new pad we heard loud, enthusiastic shouts. Oh man, that sounded so fun it made me want to drop my buddy's sectional and grab a beer. We ended up there later that night and it was pretty crowded but we still managed to find some stools. It's definitely an old school type bar for sure, darts, pool table and popcorn machine, but I like it that way. The staff is pretty friendly and helped us out with drunk food suggestions as well as late night watering holes. I would come down here for sure, especially since my friend is no down the street.

Very cool place to watch a Packers or Badgers game.  It's nice to see that Wisconsin sports are well represented in Chicago, behind "enemy lines" so to speak. The decor in this place is hilarious, quite unique, and very North Woodsy.  The only thing that sucks obviously is that you remember you are in Chicago when they charge you for your beer or bloody mary.  A bit too pricey to be genuine.  At least they got the sneaky pete chaser right.  It's not quite the same as a real Northwoods bar experience, where usually 100% of the patrons are rooting the Pack.  There were some knobbish Bears fans in there trying to rain on the Pack's parade...but it was in good fun...if they want to spend the afternoon watching the Packers amid the greatest fans in the NFL, then so be it.

Love this place.  By far one of the best places in the city to day drink.  I gotta go at night sometime so I don't sound like such the raging alcoholic...  I'm not a regular when it comes to the day drinkin'.  I can kick it in the bar, watch sports, put some jams on the jukebox, order delivery, and chill with my dog.  Hell yes.  I'm in.

I am so happy that this place exists.  I have only been here for football games (Packers), but my mind was blown:  so much Wisconsin in one bar.  It reminded me of home, and I still can't believe that such a place exists south of the state border.  The stain glass moose and bear and awesome, the prizes they give out during games are incredibly generous, and everyone is really friendly.  Oh yeah, free food during the game.   All that said, this might be an acquired taste that non-Wisconsinites won't go for.  And even me, I don't go here as much as I might like because it's kind of far from where I live.  Just the same, this place is great and I hope to go back soon.

I went here last weekend for the first time and this place is very cool. They have real darts and very cold beer. The people seemed chill so that is good...especially in Lakeview. I will be back for sure.

First of all this is a Wisconsin themed, replica bar, so that's a bad start. Second the beer prices are taxed, the one item of food (frozen pizza) is taxed and the crowd all-n-all is taxed. (Lakeview Frat crowd) The service was good, the place has cool decor. (stuffed Moose head, bobcat, etc.) Nice TVs for sports, free popcorn. Good afternoon spot or early weeknight spot except for the prices, so go w/ the special. Avoid at all costs during a Packers game unless you like hanging out w/ Cheeseballs!
The best damn place outside of Lambeau Field to watch a Packer game, period. Fun atmosphere, great drinks specials, free food, and a halftime raffle.  It's just full of green & gold awesome.

I came to Will's with a group of Packers for the MNF game against the Saints. Although the game didn't go so well for them, everyone still had a great time thanks to the bar. The crowd was so nice and everyone was friendly...must be a Wisconsin thing. I've never been to WI but I'm told by those who have that Will's is as close as you can get to being at Lambeau without actually making the trip. I was amazed by how much free food this place hands out too. There was free popcorn, hot dogs, cheese curds, brats and cheeseburgers for everyone all night long! It wasn't the best tasting food but who cares...you're in a bar and it's free!

I'm no outdoorsman, but Will's Northwoods is a breath of fresh air!  How many places in this city have a giant moose?  I mean here's a place the isn't at all bothered about whether or not it's the coolest spot in the neighborhood.  It's like taking a ski trip for a day to western Lakeview.

Free dogs on cubs night games, assortment of beers on tap including Ludwigs. Pool table, darts, jukebox, outdoor seating. This place has everything. My only gripe is that the bar staff is a little slow sometimes and it can take forever to get their attention. Sometimes they even look at you and walk by.
Perfect Bar, I could go on in a lengthy review but honestly it would not do it justice. Great people, staff, selection, decor.........moose.

What the.  Free brats, popcorn, and burgers on crowded UW game days?  Friendly bartenders that give you free pitchers of beer when you're happy hour-ing on a Friday afternoon?  Winning a knit, Badger HAT-HELMET and modeling it for the throngs of bar-goers on a Saturday morning? Priceless.  Will's is great.

Good beer, internet juke box was solid most of the patrons picking some excellent music.  Great place to watch a game, but it is clearly a Wisconsin Badgers bar.  Overall a fun place, with an enjoyable atmosphere.  I think we caught the bartender on a bad night though, not very friendly.

Will's is the illest.  I imagine Ted Nugent's house looks very similar inside.  Pool, darts, free popcorn, beer garden, jukebox...  Did you know there's a secret room and a secret bar?  They open it up when its crowded.  Totally adds to the cool factor.   Only thing that would make it cooler is if they let you ride the moose.

If the Stanger ever met Will, The Stanger would high five the s**t out of him!  The Stanger loves Will's and everything about it.  Antler chandeler? Check.  Giant Moose? Check.  Hispanic fellow selling tamalas on a weeknight? Check.  MILLER LITE? On special !!@##!@!  The Stanger loves Miller Lite Specials!!!!!!  Grrrrrrr.

Will's is awesome, and I'm not just saying that because Benny and the Jets loves it so much. It's god a great laid back atmosphere, and always has some rocking tunes playing, which the patrons have selected which of course makes it even better! I love the decor, especially the giant stuffed cougar (and the moosehead, and the carved indian by the women's bathroom), and there are pool tables and darts for those of you who need something else to do at a bar besides drink.  Don't miss the free popcorn, and at Christmas, look for Red and grab yourself a gorgeous 12 foot tree- I did!

OK...I am not even a Wisconsin fan but I LOVE THIS BAR!  It is such a shit bar, which I say lovingly, and has great drinks, HILARIOUS bar staff, pool, darts, free popcorn, you can control the music (bonus).  It has a great patio in the summer, too, and they are really into neighborhood appreciation.   Just look for the giant moose peeking its head over the hedge.  You can't miss it...and you shouldn't!

Woo!  I LOVE this place.  Will's is by far, hands-down the best Wisconsin bar in Chicago.  Doesn't have the sorority/frat vibe that Redmond's does and has more personality than Waterhouse.  This is the best place to watch all the Packers and Badgers games among your fellow Wisconsinites.  AND they have free food (burgers, brats, hot dogs, popcorn)!! Will himself comes out to give away prizes during the games; the best I've seen was a necklace made out of fake cheese wedges and sausage links, it was beautiful.  Come early, though -- it gets packed and you might not get in if you come after the start of the game.

I love I love I love Will's.  I been here many times but since I moved to Wicker Park I hadn't been to my ol' "go to" bar in a long time.  First off, its great in the summer.  The back of the bar opens up to a back yard situation. In the grassy knoll behind the bar, the area is shared with the tenants of the surrounding apartments and they are all supper cool people. While you can get your drinks at the bar you can still go outside in the back and its like a BBQ in the making.  Everyone is grillin out, playing bags, and inviting you into the fun! Inside the bar, they have a separation in the middle so really it like two separate rooms. Expect to get your drink in a plastic cup, and definitely take advantage of the popcorn machine!....This place gets really packed on the weekends but its still really fun.  There is also an abundance of really gung ho sports guys but they are all supper cool and whenever I go here I end up making a  plethora of new friends, even if it is just for the night!

I like this place. They have kid rock on the jukebox and there is free popcorn.  Always really nice people in here too. It feels like you are somewhere in Wisconsin. A good place to go when you are just looking for a place to relax and drink a couple of pitchers of beer.

The only thing that would make this bar more Wisconsin-like would be charging Wisconsin prices for the beer.   Plenty of stuffed animals (including a badger) and old fishing notices, such as one of a 1963  walleye competition, are on shelves and the walls. Leinie's on tap, Simpson's on tv, no annoying un-invited conversation from other patrons, and a bartender with a cigarette permanently attached to his lips. Maybe there is only food here during game days, because they don't have a kitchen.  You can order pizza, though, or bring food in. This is the kind of bar you want to stop in on your way home from work for a pint or two.

I vote Will's "Best place to take your Midwestern Father who is afraid of sushi, city people and mohawks for a night of drinking in Chicago." Free popcorn machine. Bonus if you love Wisconsin. Tucked away in a residential street (Racine just south of Belmont). A nice garden area to sit and conversate amongst the humid air in the summer, complete with the largest freestanding moose sculpture/creation I've ever encountered.  Decent beer selection, dartboards, pool tables, TV's, friendly staff. The food is marginal, you are better off filling up before you come...(Gino's East is down the street, among others).   Parking is atrocious...though the west side of Racine is non-permit. (Every other street is permit after 6pm, and the meter people are hawks, don't attempt unless you like valeting your car for $50).  Go Badgers and Moose! My Dad loved it.
Good key local spot to just chill and watch some games.

If you love all things Wisconsin (Packers, Badgers, brats, and beer) then you'll love this bar.  There is nothing that gets me more teary-eyed then walking into a bar adorned in Packer gear and outfitted like an old lodge in the north woods.  I am definitely looking forward to going to this place once Packer season arrives again to watch Favre's last year before he goes into the hall of fame....you'll never hear a Bear's fan mention that about the worst QB in the league by the name of Rex Grossman....emphasis on the gross.

Wills is a large bar with a neighborhood type feel.  The bartenders greet you when you walk in and will remember what you are drinking.  Pretty chill bar, free popcorn, darts.    This bar would be awesome if they let me sit on the HUGE moose out in the sideyard.  It has been a fantasy of mine for some years...

Wills has a Moose outside.  That right there is pretty cool.  I have been here a bunch but the most memorable occasion was definitely Musky Fest '06.  There were Musky queens, drunkards, free brats, live music  - all these things mixed together = one serious recipe for good times.  Recently, I stopped by Will's for a night of dart-watching (Lame, I know.  I don't play darts.  I didn't really watch darts either come to think of it.  I guess I just wanted to say that they have dart boards).   Darts woo-hoo!    My one complaint about Will's is the $20 credit card limit.  I call BS.  No way does that fly with me big Willy!

This place is interesting.  It looses a point for being a Packer Bar, but I will still go there on off days because the staff is friendly and I like fresh popcorn.  Place needs remodeling and the moose has to go, but it is still an okay place to hang out.

I'm a Bears fan and even I loved this place. Probably as much as my Packers-fan boyfriend. Unlike the majority of my football comrades, I do not hate or despise the Packers and their fans. Its a lovely rivalry steeped in history and tradition. Everybody was real cheerful and nice. Polite. Normal. Young. Old. Couples. Singles. Free food. Leinie's. (Shitty Bloody Mary's though) I love the antler chandeliers. And all the north woods imagery. The bar itself is a sight to see.

I saw the Packers win here.  Will's has complimentary cheese curds, cheese and summer sausage platters, beer-soaked grilled brats, hot dogs and cheeseburgers.   It's a little scary to be a Packer fan when you live in Chicago, but when you're at Will's, no one will mess with me in my Green and Gold Starter jacket circa 1995.  Plus, the chandelier made of antlers is incredible! The place feels like a... well, like a northwoods inn.  Lined with Packer memorabilia and Bart Starr/Vince Lombardi posters.  Cheap Leinenkugel! GO PACK.

GO PACK GO!  as a wisconsin transplant, i have found football season in chicago to be hard for me. praise the lord in heaven (for he created cheese) for wills. it's so great. best place in the city to watch the pack or the badgers (GO BIG RED!!) they have burgers and dogs and brats every week for the patrons. raffels for packer and badger tix and CHEESE AND SUMMER SAUSAGE!! it's my kind of place. oh and they have a musky fest. classic. i can't wait for football to start again!

outside of badger football games, i've never been here...but as far as catching a game there - it's the best.  i saw more old friends there than i see when i go back to madison.  everyone is so into the game -  but it's super packed.  but if you're a big wisconsin fan and want to be around other badgers for a game, it's worth the close quarters.  i've caught some legendary badger games there (WI vs. Purdue, fall 2004), and i can tell you, i was thankful to be there when starks ran the fumble back to win the game and not screaming alone at home on my couch :)
always a chill crowd here, they have plenty of space to hang out and the bartenders are very attentive.  they have good tvs too

I absolutely love this bar!  Its off of Southport so its out of the way of all the hustle and bustle of that neighborhood but still attracts quite a crowd!  The owners are from Wisconsin and so the inside is wooden and decorated with all sorts of hunting memorabilia and animal heads... they've also got a great outdoor patio!
